workflow.name: Automatic Gmail invoice PDF upload to Google Drive with spreadsheet logging
workflow.description:
## Sort invoice PDFs from Gmail to Google Drive and Google Sheets

## Who‚Äôs it for

Freelancers, finance teams, and small businesses that receive invoice PDFs by email and want them automatically saved to Google Drive and logged in Google Sheets‚Äîwithout manual downloading or copy-pasting.

## How it works / What it does

This workflow watches your Gmail inbox for unread messages that match an invoice pattern (e.g., `subject:invoice filename:pdf`). For each email, it checks for attachments, uploads each PDF to a chosen Google Drive folder, and appends a new row to a Google Sheet with useful metadata: received time, sender, subject, filename, Drive link, and IDs. Finally, it marks the original email as read to avoid duplicates.

## How to set up

1. Open the **Config (Set)** node and fill in:

   * `drive_folder_id` (or leave blank for root)
   * `spreadsheet_id` (from the Sheet URL)
   * `sheet_name` (e.g., `Invoices`)
2. Connect credentials for **Gmail**, **Google Drive**, and **Google Sheets** in each node.
3. Adjust the Gmail search query if needed (language/vendor terms).
4. Run once manually to verify data mapping, then activate.

## Requirements

* n8n with valid credentials for Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Sheets.
* A Google Sheet with appropriate headers (or let the workflow write new columns).

## How to customize the workflow

* Replace Gmail with **IMAP** or **Microsoft Outlook** if you don‚Äôt use Gmail; remove the ‚Äúmark as read‚Äù step accordingly.
* Add parsing (e.g., extract invoice totals or vendor names via PDF/AI nodes) before the Sheets step.
* Route based on vendor: create subfolders dynamically in Drive and write to different tabs.
* Notify your team by adding Slack/Email nodes after logging to Sheets.

workflow.name: Gmail Invoice PDF to Google Drive and Sheets

parameters.content:
## üìß Gmail Trigger
This node monitors your Gmail inbox for new emails containing invoices. It checks every minute for unread emails with 'invoice' in the subject line and downloads any PDF attachments.

**Configure:** Connect your Gmail account credentials

## üîç Filter Check
This filter ensures we only process emails that actually have attachments (PDFs). Emails without attachments are filtered out.

## üìÅ Google Drive Upload
Each PDF attachment is uploaded to your Google Drive. Files are named using the original filename or a timestamp if not available.

**Configure:** 
- Connect Google Drive credentials
- Optionally specify a folder ID instead of 'root'

## üìä Google Sheets Logging
Records invoice details in a spreadsheet including:
- Date/time received
- Sender email
- Subject line
- PDF filename
- Google Drive link
- File and Email IDs

**Configure:**
- Connect Google Sheets credentials
- Add your spreadsheet ID
- Ensure sheet has headers matching the column names

## ‚úÖ Mark as Processed
After successfully uploading the PDF and logging to sheets, the original email is marked as read so it won't be processed again.

**Note:** Uses same Gmail credentials as trigger

## üöÄ Setup Instructions

1. **Gmail OAuth2**: Connect your Gmail account in all Gmail nodes
2. **Google Drive OAuth2**: Connect your Google Drive account
3. **Google Sheets OAuth2**: Connect your Google Sheets account
4. **Spreadsheet Setup**: 
   - Create a Google Sheet
   - Add headers: Date, Sender, Subject, Filename, Drive_Link, File_ID, Email_ID
   - Copy the spreadsheet ID from the URL
   - Paste it in the Google Sheets node
5. **Optional**: Change the Drive folder from 'root' to a specific folder ID
6. **Test**: Send yourself an email with 'invoice' in subject and a PDF attached

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
